title: PBL-Based Problem Development Workshop: Customized Learning Problem Design via User-Centered Design Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic PBL (Project-Based Learning) Principles and Intermediate-Level Expertise in the Field (Science)
context.additional_context: A process where learner groups composed of professionals in medical/legal/technical fields develop PBL problems applicable to real work environments

learning_goals: Learners can design three PBL problems aligned with real-world work contexts using a user-centered design approach.
Learners can apply feedback mechanisms that enhance learner engagement during the problem development process.
Learners can establish criteria for evaluating the learning effectiveness (achievement, satisfaction) of developed PBL problems.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
